config.title: Schedules and Configuration
config.automation_help:
Configure how the system automatically generates and assigns tasks.

• Automatic assignment: The system finds the best available staff based on schedules, shifts, and workload.
• Generate for all rooms: Creates daily tasks even for vacant rooms (useful for preventive maintenance).
• Generation time: The system respects your hotel's timezone to generate tasks at the correct local time.
config.service_rules_help:
Define when cleaning service should or should not be performed.

• Skip on check-in/check-out: Avoids creating tasks on the exact day of guest arrival or departure.
• Linen/towel changes: Configure how many nights between changes (e.g., linens every 3 nights, towels every night).
config.time_windows_help:
Define work schedules for each shift.

• Morning/afternoon windows: Hours when staff from each shift are available.
• Quiet hours: Period when cleaning should not be performed (optional, to respect guest rest).
config.assignment_priorities_help:
Controls how tasks are distributed among staff.

• Prefer by zone: Prioritizes assigning tasks to staff from the same zone/floor as the room.
• Rebalancing: The system automatically redistributes tasks every X minutes to balance workload.
• Priorities: Define which task types have higher urgency (checkout > daily).
config.task_timeout_help:
Manages what to do when a task takes longer than expected.

• Maximum duration: Time in minutes before marking a task as overdue.
• Auto-complete: If enabled, automatically completes overdue tasks after grace period.
• Grace period: Additional minutes before auto-completing (only if auto-complete is enabled).

plans_rate_modal.name: Name
plans_rate_modal.help:
Rate Plans are base templates for defining rates.

• Name: Descriptive name of the plan (e.g., BAR, Best Available Rate).
• Code: Unique code for the plan, used for OTA integrations.
• Priority: Number that determines which plan is used when there are multiple plans (higher = more priority).
• Enabled for operation: If active, the plan can be used in reservations.

Rate Rules are created within these plans to define specific prices by dates, rooms, channels, etc.

taxes_rate_modal.name: Name
taxes_rate_modal.help:
Taxes are automatically applied to reservations.

• Hotel: Hotel the tax belongs to.
• Name: Tax name (e.g., VAT, Tourist tax).
• Channel: Specific channel where it applies (optional, if empty applies to all).
• Amount type: Percentage (e.g., 21%) or fixed amount (e.g., $10).
• Percentage/Fixed amount: Tax value according to selected type.
• Scope: Defines how it's calculated:
  - Per night: Applied each night of the reservation.
  - Per reservation: Applied once per reservation.
  - Per guest per night: Multiplied by number of guests and nights.
• Priority: If there are multiple taxes, determines application order (higher = more priority).

promo_rate_modal.name: Name
promo_rate_modal.discount_value_percent_range: If percentage must be between 0 and 100
promo_rate_modal.at_least_one_day: Select at least one day of the week
promo_rate_modal.xor_room_type: Choose room or room type (not both)
promo_rate_modal.help:
Promotions are discounts applied to reservations.

• Hotel and Plan: Defines where the promotion applies (plan optional).
• Code: Promotional code guests can use (optional).
• Date range: Dates when the promotion is active.
• Weekdays: Specific days when it applies.
• Room/Type: Applies to specific room or room type (not both).
• Channel: Specific sales channel.
• Priority: Determines which promotion applies if there are multiple.
• Scope: Per night (applied each night) or per reservation (once).
• Discount type: Percentage (e.g., 10%) or fixed amount (e.g., $50).
• Combinable: If active, can be combined with other promotions.

rules_rate_modal.name: Name
rules_rate_modal.at_least_one_day: Select at least one day of the week
rules_rate_modal.xor_room_type: Choose room or room type (not both)
rules_rate_modal.help:
Rate Rules define specific prices within a Rate Plan.

• Plan: The rate plan this rule belongs to.
• Date range: Dates when this rule applies.
• Weekdays: Specific days when it applies (e.g., weekends only).
• Room/Type: Applies to specific room or room type (not both).
• Channel: Specific sales channel (Booking, website, etc.).
• Priority: Determines which rule applies if there are multiple (higher = more priority).
• Price mode: Absolute (fixed price) or Delta (adjustment over base price).
• Base/Delta: Base price or adjustment (e.g., 100.00 or +20.00).
• Occupancy prices: Defines different prices based on number of guests.
• Restrictions: CTA (closed to arrival), CTD (closed to departure), or completely closed.
rules_rate_modal.deposit_help: If type=Percentage the value is %. If Fixed, it's an absolute amount.

policies.title: Payment Policies
policies.subtitle: Configure when and how guests are charged
policies.auto_cancel_enabled_desc: Automatically cancel pending reservations without payment
policies.auto_cancel_days_desc: Days after creating the reservation to automatically cancel if no payments
policies.deposit_section_help:
Configure how and when deposits/advances are charged for reservations.

• Deposit type: Percentage of total (e.g., 30%) or fixed amount (e.g., $500).
• Value: If percentage, enter the % (e.g., 30). If fixed amount, enter the value (e.g., 500.00).
• When to charge: At reservation confirmation, X days before check-in, or at check-in.
• Days before: Only applies if you selected "Days Before Check-in".
policies.balance_section_help:
Define when the remaining balance of the reservation is charged.

• At check-in: Charged when the guest checks in.
• At check-out: Charged when the guest checks out.

Note: This section only appears if you configured a deposit.
policies.auto_cancel_section_help:
Configure automatic cancellation of pending reservations without payment.

• Enable auto-cancellation: If active, the system automatically cancels reservations that haven't paid the deposit.
• Days for auto-cancellation: Days after creating the reservation to cancel it if there are no payments.

Example: If you set 7 days, a reservation created on January 1st will be automatically cancelled on January 8th if it has no payments.

policies.title: Cancellation Policies
policies.subtitle: Configure cancellation and refund rules
policies.free_cancellation_message_placeholder: Free cancellation up to 24 hours before check-in
policies.partial_cancellation_message_placeholder: Cancellation with 50% penalty up to 72 hours before check-in
policies.no_cancellation_message_placeholder: No cancellation allowed after 7 days before check-in
policies.cancellation_fee_message_placeholder: A 25% penalty will be applied for cancellation
policies.times_tab_help:
Define time limits for different types of cancellation.

• Free cancellation: Time before check-in to cancel without penalty (e.g., 24 hours).
• Partial refund: Time before check-in to receive partial refund (e.g., 72 hours, 50% refund).
• No refund: Time before check-in where there is no refund (e.g., 7 days).

The system evaluates backwards from check-in to determine which rule applies.
policies.restrictions_tab_help:
Configure cancellation penalties and restrictions.

• Penalty type: Percentage of total, fixed amount, first night, or percentage per night.
• Penalty value: The amount or percentage to charge.
• Allow cancellation after: Defines if cancellation is allowed after check-in, check-out, in no-show cases, or early checkout.
policies.messages_tab_help:
Custom messages that guests will see based on cancellation type.

• Free cancellation message: Shown when cancellation is free.
• Partial cancellation message: Shown when there is partial refund.
• No cancellation message: Shown when cancellation is not allowed.
• Penalty message: Shown when a penalty is applied.

These messages appear in confirmations and communications with guests.
policies.advanced_tab_help:
Advanced configuration to apply the policy selectively.

• Apply to all room types: If disabled, you can select specific types.
• Apply to all channels: If disabled, you can select specific channels (Booking, website, etc.).
• Apply to all seasons: If disabled, you can create rules by season (high, low, etc.).

policies.title: Refund Policies
policies.subtitle: Configure money refund rules
policies.no_refund_time: Time after which there is no refund
policies.times_tab_help:
Define time limits for different types of refund.

• Full refund: Time before check-in to receive full refund (e.g., 24 hours).
• Partial refund: Time before check-in to receive partial refund with percentage (e.g., 72 hours, 50% refund).
• No refund: Time before check-in where there is no refund (e.g., 7 days).

The system evaluates backwards from check-in to determine which type of refund applies.
policies.methods_tab_help:
Configure how money refunds are processed.

• Refund method: Defines how money is refunded (cash, transfer, card, voucher, or original payment method).
• Processing days: Estimated time in days for refund processing.

Example: If you selected "Bank Transfer" and 7 days, the system will indicate that the refund will be processed in 7 business days.
policies.voucher_tab_help:
Configuration for refunds via credit vouchers.

• Validity days: How many days the voucher is valid for use (e.g., 365 days = 1 year).
• Minimum amount: Minimum amount the voucher must have to be valid (e.g., $100).

Vouchers allow guests to use credit for future reservations instead of receiving money.
policies.messages_tab_help:
Custom messages that guests will see based on refund type.

• Full refund message: Shown when there is full refund.
• Partial refund message: Shown when there is partial refund.
• No refund message: Shown when there is no refund.
• Voucher message: Shown when a credit voucher is issued.

These messages appear in confirmations and communications with guests.
policies.advanced_tab_help:
Advanced configuration to apply the refund policy selectively.

• Apply to all room types: If disabled, you can select specific types.
• Apply to all channels: If disabled, you can select specific channels (Booking, website, etc.).
• Apply to all seasons: If disabled, you can create rules by season (high, low, etc.).
